definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
sentences.chinese: 犹大就把那银钱丢在殿里，出去吊死了。

sentences.english: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed.
sentences.chinese: 兵丁受了银钱，就照所嘱咐他们的去行。

sentences.english: If beat all over, this money discusses it later, from can't make the owner is white work.
sentences.chinese: 若打得出来，这银钱再谈，自不会叫老板做了白工的。

sentences.english: Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in me.
sentences.chinese: 我要是在银钱问题上粗心大意，那是不可原谅的。

sentences.english: Wisdom keeps a man from danger even as money does;
sentences.chinese: 因为智慧护庇人，好像银钱护庇人一样。

sentences.english: And they brought him a denarius.
sentences.chinese: 他们就拿一个银钱来给他。

sentences.english: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.
sentences.chinese: 犹大就把那银钱丢在殿里，出去吊死了。

definition: silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
government repository/state provincial warehouse (esp. during Qing dynasty)
money farm (dealing in illegal foreign currency of money laundering)
(in former times) banknote with a value in silver
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
Ministry of Revenue in imperial China
